thread.title: 'Common sense will prevail' on Brexit transition deal - Penny Mordaunt

title: 'Common sense will prevail' on Brexit transition deal - Penny Mordaunt
text:
February 11, 2018 / 10:06 AM / Updated 23 minutes ago 'Common sense will prevail' on Brexit transition deal - Penny Mordaunt Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
LONDON (Reuters) - British aid minister Penny Mordaunt said on Sunday she believed the government would be able to strike a transitional Brexit deal with the European Union. 
“It’s in our interests and it’s in the EU’s interests. I think common sense will prevail,” Mordaunt said when asked if she thought a deal would be reached. 
Britain is hoping to seal a transition deal next month to smooth its exit from the EU. However, Brussels said last week a deal was not a certainty and that London needed to clarify what it wanted from the EU. Reporting by William James; Editing by Andrew Heavens
